greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, A014963(n) * 0^(n-k); 1<=k<=n.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n=1..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: Infinite lower triangular matrix with A014963 (1, 2, 3, 2, 5, 1, 7, 2, 3, 1, 11,...) in the main diagonal and the rest zeros.
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
program: for(n=1,12, for(k=1,n, print1(T(n,k), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 16 2019
def T(n,k): return simplify(exp(add(moebius(d)*log(n/d) for d in divisors(n))))*0^(n-k)
[[T(n,k) for k in (1..n)] for n in (1..12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 16 2019
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_ and _Mats Granvik_, May 17 2008
